metadata.title: CVE-2020-14416 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.4.16, a race condition in tty->disc_datahandling in the slip and slcan line discipline could lead to ause-after-free, aka CID-0ace17d56824. This affects drivers/net/slip/slip.cand drivers/net/can/slcan.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14416` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-176-generic - 4.4.0-176.206
linux-image-4.4.0-176-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-176.206
linux-image-4.4.0-176-lowlatency - 4.4.0-176.206
linux-image-4.4.0-176-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-176.206
linux-image-4.4.0-176-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-176.206
linux-image-4.4.0-176-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-176.206
linux-image-4.4.0-176-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-176.206
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-176-generic - 4.4.0-176.206
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-176-lowlatency - 4.4.0-176.206
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1068-kvm - 4.4.0-1068.75
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-aws - 4.4.0-1104.115
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1063-aws - 4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1075-azure - 4.15.0-1075.80
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1058-gcp - 4.15.0-1058.62
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1035-oracle - 4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-176.206').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1068.75').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.115').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1075.80').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.62').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.139').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1134.142').
